C Developer Enviornment on Mac
Table of Contents
1. Clang
2. /usr/include
3. gdb
4. LSP server
5. Emacs
Some text.
1 Clang
brew install clang
Follow the instructions printed by homebrew to add clang to PATH.
2 /usr/include
Open the folder in where command line tools are:
open "$(xcode-select -p)/Packages"
Install macOS_SDK_headers_for_macOS_xxx.pkg. This package adds header files to /usr/include.
3 gdb
brew install gdb
You need to code sign gdb, follow instructions on https://sourceware.org/gdb/wiki/BuildingOnDarwin.
4 LSP server
Install ccls, a LSP server for C/C++.
brew tap twlz0ne/homebrew-ccls brew install ccls
5 Emacs
Install eglot in Emacs:
M-: (require 'package) M-x package-install eglot RET
Configuration for C/C++ mode:
(with-eval-after-load 'c-mode (eglot-ensure) ;; ccls has a fuzzy matching algorithm to order candidates according to your query. (setq-local company-transformers nil))
(with-eval-after-load 'c++-mode (eglot-ensure) ;; ccls has a fuzzy matching algorithm to order candidates according to your query. (setq-local company-transformers nil))
